title: Chaotic Attractor-Based Compression for High-Dimensional Machine Learning Embeddings
description: We demonstrate that ML embeddings exhibiting chaotic attractor dynamics enable extreme compression ratios exceeding 200×. Through rigorous analysis of correlation dimension D₂ and Lyapunov exponents λ₁, we identify datasets where embeddings inhabit low-dimensional manifolds (D₂ < 1). We present a novel PCA-based compression algorithm achieving 166-261× compression on synthetic datasets, with theoretical framework connecting dynamical systems and information theory.

subjects.term: Computing methodologies → Dimensionality reduction and manifold learning

references: Devlin, J., Chang, M. W., Lee, K., & Toutanova, K. (2019). BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding. NAACL-HLT 2019. doi:10.18653/v1/N19-1423
